Context:
Program Name: Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality)
Code: H312
Credential: Honours Bachelor's Degree
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 5 semesters* plus 1 co-op term
Starting Months: May
Domestic Tuition: $8,684.00 * † ‡
International Tuition: $20,217.00 ** † ‡
Centre: Hospitality & Culinary Arts
School: Hospitality & Tourism Management
Location: St. James Campus
Experiential Learning: Co-op (paid)
Delivery: Hybrid and Online for some semesters
Program Availability: Open for Spring 2024 for International students, not available for Fall 2023 or Winter 2024 for both Domestic and International students.
Related Programs: Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) (H311), Tourism and Hospitality Management (H130), Hospitality – Hotel Operations Management (H133)
Program Description: A fast-track program for students with a two-year Hospitality diploma or degree in a related field, designed to pursue a business degree focusing on hospitality. Eligible diplomas include Food and Beverage Management (H132).

* The asterisk (*) indicates that the number of semesters may vary depending on individual progress and requirements.
** The double asterisks (**) indicate that tuition fees are subject to change and may not include all additional fees or expenses. † and ‡ denote that there might be other conditions or restrictions associated with the mentioned fees.

Context:
The following diploma programs are eligible:
1. Food and Beverage Management (H132)
2. Hospitality – Hotel Operations Management (H133)
3. Special Events Management (H141)
4. Tourism and Hospitality Management (H130)
5. Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) (Fast-Track)

Students will complete a bridging semester from May to August and then go on to complete all outstanding credits toward their degree, taking approximately two additional years, plus one summer semester.

The employment prospects in the hospitality industry are outstanding. In Canada, it employs over 1.2 million people, representing over 7% of all employment. In the Greater Toronto Area alone, it accounts for almost 329,000 jobs.

The curriculum is designed to prepare students for management, supervisory and administrative careers through training in analysis and problem-solving, critical thinking, integrated operations, customer management, and international applications. Students will become technically proficient in the major components of a hospitality business, including operational processes, finance, human resources, facilities, risk management, research, sustainability, and corporate social responsibility.

Courses are offered in online and in-class hybrid format throughout the program to accommodate paid work placements. Semester 7 is delivered completely online. Students spend two paid summer terms working full-time in the industry through co-operative education, giving them a chance to apply their knowledge in a real-life situation.

Co-operative education is an important component of this degree program. Two paid work placements provide students with practical experience and further develop their skills, an asset for graduates and their future employers. Students also establish valuable contacts with potential employers, and many graduates find full-time employment with their co-op employer.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Honours Bachelor of Business Administration Program (Hospitality) (Fast-Track) H312 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The George Brown College offers a Field Education program where students spend one paid term working full-time in the industry, gaining hands-on experience. The college works with employers and industry partners to identify work experience opportunities, but students are also encouraged to pursue self-directed opportunities. This work experience can be added to resumes.

Graduates of the College's Honours Hospitality Degree program can find various career opportunities in sectors like accommodations, assembly and event management, food service, sports and recreation, and travel. Some graduates secure supervisory and managerial positions soon after graduation with starting salaries up to $50,000 depending on experience, position, and employer.

Graduates may also pursue advanced degrees from partner universities such as IMI and Manchester University or institutions like the University of Guelph, Ryerson University, University of Waterloo, Royal Roads University, and Queen's University. Acceptance to graduate studies is subject to institutions' admission criteria and entry requirements.

Required courses for Year 2, Semester 4 include HOST 2135 - Bridging.

Learning Outcomes:
The graduate will be able to:
- Assess the impact and implications of external environmental factors on the hospitality industry, its sectors, organizations and stakeholders.
- Explain the results of original research that has been conducted using social science research principles and methods.
- Apply management knowledge and technical ability for effective operation and organization of a variety of hospitality enterprises.
- Justify ideas generated, decisions made and actions taken to address business opportunities, challenges, risks and crises.
- Interpret quantitative and qualitative data.

Context:
Program Tuition Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $8,684.00 for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2022 (subject to change)
- International Tuition: $20,217.00 for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2022 and Spring 2024 (estimated, subject to change)
- Fees do not include cost of co-op work term
- Additional costs: $575 for textbooks, manuals, etc. (fees are subject to change)

Financial Assistance:
- Program is approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet OSAP eligibility criteria

Admission Requirements:
- Applicants with a two-year Hospitality diploma from George Brown College and a program GPA of 2.7 or higher, a grade of B or higher in transferred courses.
- Students completing H312 bridging semester with a 2.7 GPA or higher in any George Brown College hospitality diploma program will receive credit for the first two years of Honours Bachelor of Business Administration degree program.

Context:
The Honours Bachelor of Business Administration degree program at George Brown College lasts for a minimum of four years, with the first two years not assessed on a course by course basis. Students are required to meet certain English language proficiency standards, as specified on the college's English Proficiency page. Course exemptions and college or university credits may qualify students for waivers. The program was granted consent by the Ministry of Colleges and Universities for a seven-year term starting December 19, 2019.

Domestic students from certain programs who wish to apply for H312 are invited to do so on ontariocolleges.ca, while international (visa) students should use the Online Application System for International Students. Students should be aware of potential allergens used in practical labs and religious observance considerations regarding food.

Programs affected:
- H130 – Tourism and Hospitality Management
- H141 – Event Planning Program
- H132 – Food and Beverage Management – Restaurant Management
- H133 – Hotel Operations Management

English language proficiency requirements:
- George Brown College ESL Level 9
- TOEFL 84 overall and 21 in each skill band (online)
- IELTS 6.5 overall and 6.0 in each skill band
- MELAB 85
- CAEL overall 70 (writing 60)

Application methods for various students:
- Domestic students: ontariocolleges.ca
- International (visa) students: Online Application System for International Students

Context:
Applicants with a Hospitality diploma from another post-secondary institution requiring admission into the two-year Hospitality diploma program at George Brown College should have a program GPA of 2.7 or higher and a grade of B or higher in transferred courses. International students are advised to apply through the Online Application System and visit the How to Apply page for more information. Domestic students can contact the Admissions Office for admission requirements, deadlines, or process-related queries at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions webpage. Financial inquiries should be directed to the Financial Aid Office via FinAid@georgebrown.ca or the Financial Aid webpage. For general School of Hospitality and Tourism Management inquiries, contact chcastudentsupport@georgebrown.ca. George Brown College's Contact Centre can be reached at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002 for college-related inquiries. International students can contact recruitment representatives specializing by country of origin through the International Contact Us page or book a virtual meeting. The programs related to George Brown College include the Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) (fast-track) (H312), Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) (H311), Tourism and Hospitality Management (H130), and Hospitality – Hotel Operations Management (H133). International applicants can attend a Discovery Day to learn more about their area of interest, facilities, and meet with representatives.

Programs: Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) (fast-track) (H312), Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) (H311), Tourism and Hospitality Management (H130), Hospitality – Hotel Operations Management (H133)
Admissions: admissions@georgebrown.ca, George Brown College Online Application System
Financial Aid: FinAid@georgebrown.ca
Student Support: chcastudentsupport@georgebrown.ca
Contact Centre: 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559), long distance 1-800-265-2002, International Contact Us page, Discovery Day
Program Requirements: GPA of 2.7 or higher and a grade of B or higher in transferred courses
International Students: Online Application System, How to Apply page
